description: The Architectural Insight Generator subsystem processes static analysis call graph data and produces higher-level architectural insights by representing code as graphs, applying clustering algorithms to identify logical groupings, and packaging results into standardized cluster representations for downstream consumption. Its main flow constructs and manipulates a CallGraph, runs adaptive clustering algorithms to find related components, and transforms algorithm outputs into structured ClusterResult objects that other tools can use for documentation or further analysis.

components.name: Graph Data Model
components.description: Defines the fundamental graph structures (Node, Edge, CallGraph) used to represent the codebase as a directed call graph and provides graph construction, manipulation, and querying operations.

components.name: Clustering Algorithms
components.description: Encapsulates graph-based clustering logic (e.g., adaptive clustering) that traverses the CallGraph, computes relationships and similarity metrics, and identifies logical clusters of code entities.

components.name: Clustering Orchestrator
components.description: Manages and coordinates the clustering process: accepts CallGraph input, selects/configures algorithms, initiates execution, and collects raw outputs; acts as the primary interface for starting clustering analysis.

components.name: Cluster Result Data Structure
components.description: Defines the standardized output model (ClusterResult) that represents hierarchical and flat cluster views, cluster contents, associated files, and nodes for downstream consumption.

components.name: Cluster Result Builder
components.description: Transforms raw algorithm outputs and orchestrator results into structured ClusterResult instances, handling aggregation, post-processing, and any final formatting or language-specific adjustments.
